text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with Eastern North Carolina
barbecue sauce that's right as promised
during the paper pork video I'm going to
show you my West Coast twist on this
very unusual barbecue sauce so I guess
this actually makes this a western style
Eastern North Carolina style barbecue
sauce and not only is this stuff amazing
on any kind of barbecued meat it's also
ridiculously easy to make in fact
there's actually more directions in the
name than there are directions in the
recipe so let's go ahead and get started
with the least important ingredient
which would be a little bit of some type
of sweetener and for my version I'm
going to use honey back in North
Carolina sugar would be way more common
if added at all many recipes don't add
any so that's up to you you have been
are and always will be the boss of your
sauce even weird ones like this and then
after this sweet we're going to go with
some heat starting with a whole bunch of
freshly ground black pepper and not a
little we're doing a lot followed by an
equally crazy-looking amount of red
pepper flakes and then once we have our
little bit of sweet and a whole lot of
heat we're going to add the most
important ingredient the vinegar which
believe it or not makes up most of this
sauce and I like to use two kinds I like
to go with 1/2 apple cider vinegar and
then half just plain white distilled
vinegar and if you can try to get most
of it in the bowl although some white
vinegar on the counter is not a bad
thing
you see this green squeeze bottle that
actually contains white vinegar diluted
with water which is pretty much what I
use for like 90% of Kitchen cleanups but
anyway let's wipe that up and continue
on with the last ingredient which is
going to be a little touch of salt and
that is going to be it as soon as we
take a whisk and mix this up our western
style Eastern North Carolina style
barbecue sauce is done and you'll hear
the old timer say once this is mixed up
the liquid should look like a murky
North Carolina swamp and while I did
just make that up it kind of sounds like
something that could be true and I'm
encouraging you to take that story and
share it with your guests and don't
think of it as being dishonest think of
it as being colorful so we'll give that
a mix and like I said we are pretty much
done and sure if you want to give it a
taste but there's a problem a sauce like
this is really hard to taste as is
alright you're really not going to
appreciate something like this until
it's on some beautiful rich smoky meat
so if you are making this for the
first time don't be surprised if you're
going to have to do a little bit of
adjusting and then if you want you can
eat this right away but it's much better
the next day so I do recommend making it
a little bit ahead of time which I did
not do I went ahead and serve mine
immediately on some paper pork which
really was unbelievable the whole idea
behind this style of sauce is the
contrast between that smoky fatty meat
in this thin spicy bracing vinegary
sauce which makes for just an absolutely
fantastic pairing whoops where you going
did you see how I took care of that
digitally so anyway to summarize awesome
on any kind of meat barbecued or
otherwise and then let's go ahead and
finish this up by showing you my
recommended method for storage and
service which would be in one of these
plastic squeeze bottles just make sure
you cut off enough of that nozzle so you
have a big enough opening so your chili
flakes don't get stuck because that will
definitely cause some issues and then
we'll just use a funnel to fill that up
and we'll screw on the top and that's it
just place that next to your pork
shoulder or whatever you're serving this
with and you are good to go just
remember to give it a little shake
before using and you're going to be as
they say in hog heaven but anyway there
you go my take on a North Carolina style
barbecue sauce sort of a bonus video
since I'm actually off this week and
heading down to Southern California for
a top-secret project I know it's so
mysterious but all will be revealed in
good time and speaking of good time I
really do hope you give this deliciously
different barbecue sauce a try soon so
head over to food wishes comm for all

you
